turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Just <u>hold it</u>, <u>hold it</u>!  Computer: have you attempted to analyze the transmission?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: Yes.  There are two points of salient interest.  Number one: it is highly systematized, indicating intelligent origin.  Number two: certain sounds are inconsistent with the human palate.

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: I have interrupted the course of the voyage.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What?  <u>Why</u>?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: I am programmed to do so if certain conditions arise.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Unknown!  What do you mean?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: It is none of the 678 dialects spoken by technological man.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: I have a temporary sequence on the monitor --

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Hold it, I can't hear a damn thing!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Computer!  I've turned all the cooling units back on!  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: The reaction has proceeded too far. The core has begun to melt.  Engines will overload in 2 minutes, 35 seconds.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Just a minute, hold it, I'm checking.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Has the hull been breached?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: How long to fix?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Hard to say.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Well, get started.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Right.  Talk to you.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Hello, Faust!

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: How's it coming on the engines?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: <u>He</u> died.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Not <u>they</u>... <u>he</u>...

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Sorry to interrupt, but I'm gonna charge up the engines for a minute, okay?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Yeah, okay.  Go ahead.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Yes?  What is it?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Jay, we've got a problem.  I was wondering if there was any way you could shortcut the repairs and give us immediate takeoff capability.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Why, what's wrong?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: The computer's translated the alien signal, and it's kind of alarming.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: It couldn't translate the whole thing, only three phrases.  I'll just read it to you the way I got it:  "... HOSTILE... SURVIVAL... ADVISE DO NOT LAND... "  And that's all it could translate.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: You like this shit?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: It grows on you.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: You know what they make this stuff out of?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Yes, I know what they make it out of, so what?  It's food now.  <u>You're</u> eating it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I didn't say it was bad for you, it's just kind of sickening, that's all.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: But we can't kill it.  If we kill it, it will spill all its body acids right through our hull and out into space.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Shit...

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: We could cut a section out of that metallite netting.  It won't hold up to that acid, but aside from that it's pretty strong.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: We have to avoid injuring it.  What we really need is some electric animal prods.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Where's it coming from?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Machine's screwed up, I can't tell. Needle's spinning all over the dial.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: That way.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What happened to the lights?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Bulbs burned out, nobody bothered to replace 'em.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Where does that go?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: All over the ship; we'll have to check the charts to know for sure.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: What happened?  Where's Sandy?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Dead.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Dead!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: It's monstrous -- it grew, like some horrible tapeworm.  We were completely unprepared.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: It's still in the ship?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: What the hell's going on?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Don't know -- Broussard got hurt somehow.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Hurt!  How?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Don't know -- maybe we'll be real lucky and he just broke his neck.  I knew we shouldn't of come down here.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Oh -- God -- oh --

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Is it alive?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Boy do I feel a lot better.  It's a straight shot back to the Colonies, and then we can start taking bids on the paydirt.  Any bets on the top bid?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Well, we should at least be able to each buy our own planet.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Oh, no.  Oh, no.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: What was that?  What the Christ was that?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: And then we run out of food and oxygen.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: The water will still recycle.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: That one section of the ventilator shaft has only two outlets -- you notice?  The food storage room on one end --

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: -- And the cooling unit on the other.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Well, uh... good luck.  I hope you won't need me, but if you do, I'm here.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Martin, this is Jay.  The intakes are clogged with dust.  We overheated and burned out a whole cell.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Damn it!  How long to fix?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Jay... how's it coming on the repairs?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Well... I'm going to have to blow the engines out...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: And when will you be ready to do that?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Oh -- I'm not near ready yet.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Then why the hell are you sitting around here?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It's really on there tight.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Here, let me try.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Hey, guess what?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: The engines are fixed.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: This dust is getting clogged in the intakes again!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Just hold us together till we're in space, that's all!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Oh it's okay.  I've had better cag than this, but I've had worse too, if you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: I kind of like it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: So does anybody have any suggestions?

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: We could put on our pressure suits and blow all the air out of the ship.  That would kill it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No, we can't afford to lose that much oxygen.  We're going to have to flush it out.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Might even incinerate the damn thing.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I hope not.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: It's clear.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: All right -- Roby and Melkonis will go with Faust.  Hunter and I will make up the second team.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It looks completely different from the first one -- it's more like a worm with legs... and tentacles.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Well we better do something.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: So it's trapped in between -- now we have to drive it out.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Poison gas...

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Hey, are you guys still there? What's going on?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Meet us on the bridge.  Be careful -- it's <u>huge</u> now.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: There's some more combustible fuel down in the storage lockers next to the lounge.  I'll go get it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No, I don't want us separated.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: You just sealed it off; it can't get to that section.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: All right... but do <u>not</u> go below decks.

turns.speaker: FAUST
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: And be right back.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: He wouldn't open the lock; he was going to leave us out there.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Yeah... well, maybe he should have.  I mean, you brought the goddamn thing in here.  Maybe <u>you</u> deserve to get slapped.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Where did it come from?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: <u>He's</u> the only one that knows that.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: How does he breathe?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Blood's thoroughly oxygenated.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Yeah, but how?  His nose and mouth are blocked.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We can't expect to understand a life form like this.  We're out of our back yard.  Things are different here.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Well, can't we kill it?  I mean, we can't leave the damn thing on him.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We don't know what might happen if we tried to kill it.  At least right now it's keeping him alive.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: How about cutting it off?  We can't pull it loose, but we can cut off everything but the bottom layer, where it's stuck to his face.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: God, that smoke's poisonous!

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: It's eating a hole in the floor!

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: I never saw anything like that in my life... except molecular acid.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: But this thing uses it for <u>blood</u>.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Hell of a defense mechanism.  You don't dare kill it.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: It makes me sick to see him like that.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Isn't there some way we can get it off him?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: It's a crude symbolic language -- looks primitive.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: You can't tell -- that kind of stuff could represent printed circuits...

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: We can't go into hypersleep with that thing running around loose.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: We'd be sitting ducks in the freezers.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It's over, Hunter.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Boy, that's terrific.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well, how does it feel to be rich men?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: That thing, God almighty, didn't you try to get it off him?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It wouldn't come.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Hey now, what is this?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Ask him.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: There.  Should be coming through about there.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Careful, don't get under it!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I'll do it.  The rest of you continue.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I'll come with you.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: You know, it's fantastic -- the human race has gone this long without ever encountering another advanced life form, and now we run into a veritable zoo.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well, those things out there aren't the same, you know -- the spaceship and the pyramid.  They're from different cultures and different races.  That ship just landed here -- crashed like we did.  The pyramid and the thing from it are indigenous.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: How could anything be indigenous to this asteroid?  It's dead.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Maybe it wasn't always dead.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Now we're in for it.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: The door was closed.  It must still be in here.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No, don't open the door.  We don't want it escaping.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Well, what the hell good can we do in here?  We can't grab it -- it might jump on us --

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Maybe we can catch it.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: How's Broussard?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: He's running a fever.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Still unconscious?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Can you do anything for him?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: The machine will bring his temperature down.  His vital functions are strong.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I think I could cobble something together.  A long metal rod with a battery in it.  Give it a hell of a shock.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Good.  Get on it.  But first, I'm issuing a standing order: from this moment forth, every one of us will wear protective garments, including helmets.  Let's get down to the locker and change.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Don't worry, it won't damage it, it'll just give it a little incentive.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: How do we locate the creature?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Maybe we don't have to.  It's trapped in there.  We could just leave it in there all the way back to Irth.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Don't be an idiot.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: We can't pump poison gas down into the cooling unit!  It'll flood the whole ship!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: The only other thing I can think of is for somebody to crawl in there and flush it out.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: While the rest of us wait down in the cooling unit with the net.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Sounds like a rough one.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Got a better idea?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We'd better seal off the lower maintenance level; at least trap it there.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: At least it can't get up here now.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Listen, it sure didn't like this flamethrower.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: That's right -- we can't kill it on the ship, but we can at least keep it at bay -- and maybe drive it into the air lock.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Thing is, I'm about out of fuel.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We've got six hours left.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Does anybody know what happened?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Oh no!  We can't fight this thing! There's only six hours of air left -- we're dead men!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I don't buy that.  There's still time to destroy it and get ourselves in the freezers.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: <u>How</u>?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It's time for drastic remedies.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: If we could just get the <u>creature</u> into the lifeboat, we could launch it into space and blow it up.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Good!  That's good!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: We can load the lifeboat up with explosives and trigger them remotely, once the lifeboat is in space.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: You can't say that; I think it's a good plan.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: The flamethrower needs more fuel.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Right.  We've got a lot to accomplish.  Let's get moving.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: The ship's gravitational attraction must have drawn him back.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Should we go outside and bring him in?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: No... the risk is too great.  Perhaps after we've destroyed the thing.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: It will be.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What we really need is some red meat in here for bait.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Well... now we have to herd that thing up here.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Whoever's doing the herding is gonna have their hands pretty full.  I think somebody should stay by the lifeboat to slam the door on the thing once it's inside, and to serve as... as...

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: It must have stopped moving.  I'm not getting anything.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Let me go first; you stay behind me.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: The flamethrower!

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: I can't, the acid will pour out!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Now what's wrong?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I've completely lost their signal.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Can you get them back?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I'm trying.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What?  What was that?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: The computer just translated the goddamn message.  It's not an S.O.S. It was a warning.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I'm getting nowhere.  The whole area around the pyramid is dead to transmission.  I think we should go after them.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What do you mean, no?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: We're not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: But they don't know about the translation!  They could be in danger right now.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: We can't spare the personnel.  We've got minimum takeoff capability right now.  That's why Chaz left us on board.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Why, you chickenshit bastard --

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Just can that crap!  I'm in command here till Chaz returns!  And nobody's leaving this ship!

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I've got 'em!  They're back on my screens!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: How many?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Three blips!  They're coming this way!

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Jay, this is Cleave!  Meet me at the main air lock!

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I keep my mouth pretty much shut, but I don't like hitting.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I guess I had it coming.  Let's call it settled.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Look at that.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What is it -- I can't tell anything --

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: It's some kind of organ -- it's inserted some kind of tube or something down his throat.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Oh... God...

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I think that's how it's getting oxygen to him.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: It doesn't make any sense.  It paralyzes him... puts him into a coma... then keeps him alive.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What's happening up here?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I think it's fizzled out.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: This is horrible.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Hey!  what about the film?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: That must have been when he got it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: The same thing must've happened to the creatures on the other ship... except they took one of those jars on board, and opened it there.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: What common objects?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Listen, hadn't somebody better check on Broussard?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: You mean his body was still kicking when it ran off with him?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: It was horrible -- horrible.  Like a chicken.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Don't count on it.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: We sure need this flamethrower.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Recognizable!  In that?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: In symbolic form... very stylized... but if you stare at it, you can see some of the different creatures we've been dealing with.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Well... I suppose that star-shaped thing could be the parasite that got on Broussard.  Is that what you mean?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: And right next to it, that oval design with the markings -- it's a dead ringer for the spore casings.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: ... And Broussard got caught in their reproductive cycle.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: You will notice, though, that there are no more phases.  Only four forms are shown.  After that the pattern repeats.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: We can't kill it on board.  It's huge now and must have tremendous amounts of that acid in its body.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I've got an idea, but you're not going to like it.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Blow the ship up?

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: And the creature with it.  We can make it back to Irth in the lifeboat.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What about all the minerals and elements in the cargo hold?  That's the only reason we came out here. We'd have to abandon them all.  We'd be broke.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Our lives are more important. Anyway, we can take a small amount of the most valuable stuff with us on the lifeboat.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I think it's going to be almost impossible to drive it up into the lifeboat.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: We can use the flamethrower.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: It's not going to work.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: This should do it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: I should hope so!  And we'd better make sure it's pretty far from the ship when we blow it.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Isn't "bait" the word you used?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Hey look, somebody has to have his hands free to lock the creature in the lifeboat!

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Just keep your finger off the button till she's way away from the ship, that's all.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Is it armed?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: If you press the button right now, it will blow the whole nose of the ship off.

turns.speaker: ROBY
turns.text: Thanks for the thought.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Sandy, you want to give us some vision?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: Feast your eyes.

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: First contact...

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Sandy, can you home in on that beam?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: What's the frequency?

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Computer, what's the frequency of the transmission?

turns.speaker: MELKONIS
turns.text: I've got it.  It's coming from ascension 6 minutes 32 seconds, declination -39 degrees 2 seconds.

turns.speaker: STANDARD
turns.text: Dell -- show me that on a screen.
